abstracts.cdata!:
The Road Development Program Project -
            Phase 2 - will improve access to rural, and economically
            productive areas, by removing transport services constraints
            on Uganda's road network. This will necessarily involve
            land acquisition, therefore this resettlement action plan
            (RAP) aims to ensure that displaced people benefit from the
            project, minimizing social disruption, so as to improve
            their livelihoods, and, restore their income. The RAP is
            based on the country's 1995 Constitution, and legal
            framework, the Land, and Land Acquisition Acts (1998 and
            1965), and, on the Bank's operational guidelines
            regarding resettlement. Compensation standards for assets
            lost will be at replacement costs, its valuation applicable
            to land tenure types. Grievance mechanisms will be available
            for disputes over land acquisition, and resettlement issues.
            Access to training, employment, and credit opportunities
            will be made available to displaced people, through
            vocational training for either new employment, or incentives
            via credit for small business expansion as appropriate.
            Construction allowances, will be provided, as will
            infrastructure services (e.g., water supply), and social
            services (e.g., schools, health facilities). Implementation
            of the resettlement process will be monitored and evaluated
            during project preparation.
